semantic_title: Drug Use During Pregnancy, Childbirth and Puerperium
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 15. Pregnancy, Childbirth, and the Puerperium > l. Alcohol, tobacco and drug use during pregnancy, childbirth and the puerperium > 3) Drug use during pregnancy, childbirth and the puerperium

content.full_text: Codes under subcategory O99.32, Drug use complicating pregnancy, childbirth, and the puerperium, should be assigned for any pregnancy case when a patient uses drugs during the pregnancy or postpartum. This can involve illegal drugs, or inappropriate use or abuse of prescription drugs. Secondary code(s) from categories F11-F16 and F18-F19 should also be assigned to identify manifestations of the drug use. (Evidence: pg no: 68, L60-L63)
content.summary: Guidelines for coding drug use in pregnancy including illegal drugs and prescription drug abuse with required secondary coding (Evidence: pg no: 68, L60-L63)
key_concepts: O99.32 for any drug use in pregnancy/postpartum (Evidence: pg no: 68, L60-L61)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign O99.32 and secondary F11-F16, F18-F19 codes for drug use in pregnancy (Evidence: pg no: 68, L60-L63)
detailed_rules.explanation: Any drug use during pregnancy or postpartum requires both obstetric complication code and substance use disorder codes (Evidence: pg no: 68, L60-L63)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Includes illegal drugs and inappropriate use or abuse of prescription drugs (Evidence: pg no: 68, L61-L62)
detailed_rules.explanation: Drug use coding applies to both illegal substances and misused prescription medications (Evidence: pg no: 68, L61-L62)
